sentence.Network_en: A little way below the ridge was an outcrop of rock that made a rough shelter.
sentence.Network_cn: 山脊下方不远处有一块露出地面的岩石，大致形成了一个掩蔽处。

sentence.Network_en: The Main Chromitite Seam and the Merensky Reef do not outcrop well.
sentence.Network_cn: 主铬铁岩矿层及麦仑斯基矿层出露不好.

sentence.Network_en: Practically every rock outcrop shows numberless joints.
sentence.Network_cn: 实际上所有岩石的露头都显示许许多多的节理.

entry.def: or outcropping An outcrop is a large area of rock sticking out of the ground.

example.tran: 露出地面的花岗岩粗糙岩层

example.ex: ...rocky outcrops, covered in trees and bushes.
example.tran: 掩藏在树木和灌木丛下的岩石露头

means.word_mean: 1. the part of a rock formation that appears above the surface of the surrounding land
1. appear on the surface, come to the surface on the ground;

auth_sentence.content: The outcrop is thought to contain clays, similar to a rock recently drilled by Curiosity.

auth_sentence.content: The ancient rocks found by Opportunity occur as a light-toned outcrop known as Whitewater Lake.
